Besides the classic cliffhanger present in all Half-Life games, the game is not only a great improvement from the last one, but it is also super fun and engaging to play. And do not forget about the story and the worldbuilding: everything comes together to an amazing visual focused gameplay. 

Highly recommended!

One of the best FPS of all time. If you don't own it, buy it. It is an amazing game with and incredible story and episodes.

The FPS industry would not exist in its current form without this series and most importantly this game. This website and platform would be a shell of what it is today without this series. 
Half Life 2 is one of the biggest cornerstones of gaming among the likes of Mario, Tetris and DOOM. 
Although the game is dated in graphics it is still one of the most rich and telling stories out there and has inspired so much.
Not having Half-Life 2 in your steam library is a crime against humanity and yourself, give it a play.

So what can i say about this game after 2 hours of playing... 
I guess it was a unique game in the past and maybe way ahead of it´s time with interesting gameplay and clever plot.
But if you ask me Valve created better games like Counter Strike or Left4Dead with more catchy gameplay mechanics.
I dont get the high Metacritic Score and the logic behind it. And there is nothing left to say more than this.
Try for yourself and play it, but dont expect too much from it. 6/10.

An absolute masterpiece to say the least, half-life 2 is one of the best first person shooter. But this is the number 1 in terms of story-telling

Aside from being a technical masterpiece, your given a life where you'll see the story of Gordon Freeman, unraveling right through your eyes. In your own perspective, the story is happening as you play. A well-crafted story that is backed by innovative gameplay wherein you are given freedom on how will you approach each situation, thanks to the Source Engine graphical advantage and its Havoc Physics Engine.

From another technical perspective, You'll able to quickly distinguish that the game looks Old but the Engine Itself looks way more Advance in 2004. The game still rivals the current generation of games as of today, and became a staple to gaming history.

I've played this game for 30 hours and ive played it all the way through 3 times, and every time i love it. I remember younger me absolutely loved to roleplay in Ravenwood, and id spend hours blasting saw blades through head crabs. Most of my time playing this game has been inside of Ravenwood and honestly? Time well spent. This game is going to forever stick with me, I highly suggest it.

Un des meilleurs jeu de chez Valve
Amazing game I love it. Please buy it we need to convince Valve to come out with another one!

So 2021 was the first year when I got in touch with Half Life series. I knew "where Half Life 3" from the meme, but now I can fully understand why are people demanding a continue to this story.
Another post-apocalyptic world right? But this one is different, it's far from any generic post-apo vision, it's really original and surprisingly engaging. As in the first Half Life game this time Valve also flexs with the innovative gameplay mechanics eg. by telling you to pick up a can or encouraging to use a gravity gun. Almost every item in the game can be used as a weapon with this fun device. I'm sure this left many people with their jaws dropped back in 2004.
This game has almost no flaws besides not having a closed story and a mute protagonist. All the rest like gameplay, characters and aesthetics is a top notch as for a 2004 standards, even setting a new quality of story driven gameplay for the future generations of video games.
